title: Timeoutable timeouts causing Rails to flash[:timedout] as "true"
body:
I know this has been mentioned [in](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/193) [other](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/219) tickets, but it appears to still be an issue, as of 2.0.4. From the current, master's [failure_app.rb](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/blob/3cbced4e4e644d18c8a5a7043d8fefde9829087a/lib/devise/failure_app.rb#L80): ``` ruby def redirect_url if warden_message == :timeout flash[:timedout] = true attempted_path || scope_path else scope_path end end ``` The third line there is causing the Rails `Flash::FlashHash` object instance to carry a flash[:timedout] whose value is of TrueClass. For generalized flash implementations, such as the [one generated](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/blob/3cbced4e4e644d18c8a5a7043d8fefde9829087a/test/rails_app/app/views/layouts/application.html.erb) and recommended by this gem: ``` erb <%- flash.each do |name, msg| -%> <%= content_tag :div, msg, :id => "flash_#{name}" %> <%- end -%> ``` The following HTML is being generated and displayed to visitors: ``` html
true
``` Obviously, this is non-ideal. :) Is this `:timedout` flash message actually used for anything? I see that the failure_app is [explicitly keeping](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/blob/3cbced4e4e644d18c8a5a7043d8fefde9829087a/lib/devise/failure_app.rb#L57) the :timedout flash message, even though it's simply a `true` statement: ``` ruby def redirect store_location! if flash[:timedout] && flash[:alert] flash.keep(:timedout) flash.keep(:alert) else flash[:alert] = i18n_message end redirect_to redirect_url end ``` Based on a cursory reading of this code, it seems to me that a simple instance variable, which is set to true/false and nilified with each Rack `call` request, would provide the same functionality and work significantly better. And, yes, I did see @josevalim's [comment on the use of Flash](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/commit/275c480f89f814af7135093a507ab57397729faf#commitcomment-925730)... I just wonder if either the README and example application layout should be updated to reflect the check for String-iness or the surprising usage of Flash for non-user messages should be removed.
